title: why does it take so long to be punished
body: a person or a group of people can blatantly troll to ruin a person league experience and it would require many many games until they are punished at all.

replies.body:
To a extent I can understand why it takes so long. Because of how vague and different peoples definition are of some things (trolling/feeding/toxic) it's understandable why they want to make sure they aren't banning people for the wrong reason. I mean people assume that trolling is just goin off meta. Which had never been the case. But I'm sure people abuse the report button and try to ban people. Or people who might be having a bad game. You wouldn't want that one bad game to make it so you end up getting permaban! 

The thing is people like that aren't always going to be obvious. I think if people use the chat and claim their actions should be an automatic ban. But then when people find out they just won't use the chat, or make it less obvious.

many time they do claim in chat  and in that case I believe they should be punished maybe not perma banned but punished in some way. the amount of game being destroyed before being punished right now is pretty absurd.

The community is toxic and nothing will ever change it. I just wish Riot would drop its pseudo-scientific, behavioral bull-plop and stop pretending any of the crap they do actually works on a significant scale. I get flamers and trolls in more than half the games I play. The least they can do is stop patronizing us by pretending they have a working system in place.

exactly, the problem is that there is a huge population of ~~players~~ mostly dum kids I imagine, who eat up all this psuedo-intellectual pig slop like there's no tomorrow.

Yet another situation where we need Tribunal please Rito.  
It's been 2 years.
You keep popping out new champs and skins and reworks because those make money, but the community is suffering from toxicity in the meantime.  
I see so many of these type of posts about groups that troll or report and the single player has little to no power.  
The automated system can only work so well, and when it sees one person with 4 reports and 4 people with 1 report I bet it punishes the person with 4 reports, even though it may have been the 4 that caused the problem. Rito please.

First off from someone who was on tribunal - the backlog of reviews that was present made issuing punishment take even longer than the current system.

Secondly, it does not punish a person more if multiple people report the individual for the same game. Each report creates a flag for the game and then that game is reviewed by the automated system to determine (usually by the chat log more than anything) if a punishment is necessary.
i honestly feel like riot may just be saying this so people dont ask for reports

I never said the automated system is slower, just not as good. 

And I have never seen the "A player has been punished" screen when I was the only person to report someone. Only when several people from a game agree to report a person together. I don't know if that's how it works I'm just saying.

A lot of what needs to be said has been said already, but i can guarantee that the behavioral team isnt working on new champs. If they were they never would have let bard or tahm kench through XD

I could be wrong but i think they only do cheating bans in waves. Troll bans are done by the automated system (which needs work in that area).
It's just denial. Plain and simple, I mean I understand their logic of  banning people in huge waves, but they clearly don't care about the time in between, and it's effects on players.
